lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Me and Marisha have been Loot Crate--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: --purveyors for like three years.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But they've been awesome enough and interested in helping us sponsor this next month of content, so that being the case, if we want to go ahead and open some of these boxes real fast, and see, so you're aware of the kind of stuff that Loot Crate does. While they're opening this, Loot Crate is a monthly subscription box service that's 20 bucks a month and you get six to eight unique items that are based on a specific theme every month.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Leeloo Dallas Multipass!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the one that comes with the Harry Potter socks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, Matt, you were talking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. You guys show off what you got.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a little cute facehugger for the face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, a drinking horn!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I'm good. I'm good on that, thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This fabulous Labyrinth t-shirt, which Travis is sporting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think if David Bowie can't keep you alive, I don't know what can. Original War of the Worlds and The Day the Earth Stood Still prints?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, the cool thing about this is, they send you a new crate every month that has a certain theme and the content in that is based around that theme. If you go to www.lootcrate.com/criticalrole, you can enter the code 'criticalrole', one word, to save $3 on your new subscription, so if you're thinking about it and you want to try it out for a little while, go ahead and use our code and get yourself a nice little discount, which is rad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The other neat thing about Loot Crate boxes is you can turn them inside out and they become something. This one's an arcade machine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This one's got a maze on the inside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I keep all my stuff in these boxes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, they're good storage boxes. Or regifting boxes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That the invasion box?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. There's an invasion box, a quest box, and a power box, but we don't have that yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet, power box, I think, is this month.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) That was a good month.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think May is World of Warcraft, DBZ. It's got all these amazing things and I was like, I'm a part of all of these things and I want it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I like how it's essentially a really tiny pre-stream Critmas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, you could watch us open stuff all night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've already lost control of the episode.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go to Loot Crate, click the link. Show some love.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, yeah, lootcrate.com/criticalrole. You can put in 'criticalrole' as your code there and you'll get 3% off your subscription.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: $3 off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or yeah, sorry, $3, not 3%. Much better than 3%. I'm so stupid. $3. It's awesome. Thank you, Loot Crate! Next announcement we have, for those who missed it previously, it is now available: the latest issue of Rat Queens, in which Vox Machina make a cameo appearance during a certain bar-crawl portion of the issue. And some wayward bard ends up trying to buy a drink for one of the members.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's got glorious hair, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has glorious hair, which, mine is shorter now, but it'll grow. Don't worry, those of you who freaked out. I've already gotten people who're like, "You cut it!" and I'm like, "It's hair! I "live in the Valley where it's hot."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's not really hot right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Supposedly, for those who haven't seen it, the next run on Signal Boost, the show that Marisha writes and produces for, has a new person hosting the next series of episodes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be great. No, I'm having a lot of fun. We're putting it together, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's going to be weird. We're going even weirder. So for everyone who already hates how weird it is, buckle up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, there is a new series of Geek and Sundry website content coming up called Ask Vox Machina, in which Vox Machina members have been written to by various people living in the world of Tal'Dorei, asking how to solve their problems. Our wondrous players here are answering them in character. I believe the first one is going to be Sam, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, Scanlan got some great letters from the fans, and he replied with some award-winning advice. So, check that out tomorrow on geekandsundry.com.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Participation awards all around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Did you say anticipation awards?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Participation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I like anticipation awards, too. There's a video game that some people may have heard of called Uncharted 4 that's coming out. Reviews have been coming out and everyone's giving it the best game of forever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nadine Ross in the story.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, she's a villain, so you get to face off with her. It's really fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is exciting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are a good actor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And in the multiplayer you might hear me try and kill you a couple times.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, kill him a lot for what he's about to do!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You also might hear me try to heal you a couple times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so between us, we got you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right, I remember when we were going in for multiplayer, it was like, we've got several members of Vox Machina as the multiplayer characters, which is pretty ridiculous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And we've already hit a million views on it in a day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Which is weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dungeons and Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a good time when you can dress up as your D&D characters for a weekend and people on Facebook are like, cool. Like, that's the weirdest thing ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A million people go, huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Huh. That's a thing. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Although I did get made fun of already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some fan pointed out that I looked stupid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did they really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wouldn't call that person a fan, necessarily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They say that (funny voice) I love the intro but Laura Bailey looks stupid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (fake cries)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry I wrote that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was Sam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, last couple things here. The title song actually for that intro, written by our wondrous friend of the show, Jason Charles Miller, who you saw play as Garthok, the half-orc rogue a number of episodes back, who wrote our original theme and the new one, has it up on iTunes. So if you want to have the most badass, nerdy ringtone and/or music to play on repeat until you start bleeding out of your nose, that is now available on iTunes, so you can search for the Critical Role intro music. It's awesome. All right, Liam, you want to take it away?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's true we may die, and when our bones are turned to dust, carry them away in Wyrmwood gaming boxes, the finest wooden boxes for carrying the remains of the dead ever. They're great! Oh and you can put dice in 'em too, which is probably their intended purpose. And if you like them, they have many different kinds of woods, you go to wyrmwoodgaming.com. And if you want to pay for shipping, you can, but if you don't want to pay for shipping, use the code 'critrole'.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Critrole!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It looks like this on any wood. And you put your dice in it, cards in it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My favorite part of Wyrmwood Gaming is the magnets. Magnets, bitch! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's so satisfying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, that kickstarter, a couple more hours, then finito if you want to get in on that. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool. And last but not least on my list, it says 'death to all puppies'. I don't know who wrote that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who would write that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was you, Matt. It was you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. So! Leaving off from last week's episode, the party of intrepid adventurers, Vox Machina, trying to save the whole of Tal'Dorei from the Chroma Conclave, a collection of chromatic dragons that have destroyed many of the main cities here, have gone about searching for items called the Vestiges of Divergence, magical artifacts from a war of ancient times that apparently hold some great power that could aid in defeating these dragons. One of which, apparently, is being held by Kevdak, the leader of the herd of roaming tribal barbaric individuals that Grog once belonged to, and had beaten the crap out of and left Grog for dead long ago. While the dragons had destroyed part of Westruun and left it behind, this tribe utilized that time to take over the town, enslaving or keeping most of the people under their thumb, and making an accord with the one black dragon, Umbrasyl, that is currently in a tenuous relationship right now with these herd members, Herd of the Storm, as they're known. You, having sent a few of them to their death via a trap on the outside, found your way into the city, saved some of the individuals that lived there, as well as Kaylie and Dr. Dranzel, and Grog went ahead and issued a challenge to the Herd to meet with Kevdak himself. After some fairly decent intimidation checks, it was agreed, and while most of the party stealthed behind, you made your way to the very center of the town square, where Kevdak leapt off the top of the ex-Margrave's homestead and the two of you began to do battle in a pit of spikes that was gathered in the center of the town square, surrounded by a number of the clan watching on. During this fight, it went back and forth a bit before Grog felt that this was a losing battle should it continue in this way and decided to, at least it seemed to me, call out to his friends for aid with the classic Shakespearean battle cry of, "Vox Machina, fuck shit up!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's from Coriolanus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, sorry, Coriolanus, thank you. And that is where we're picking up. So--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holy shit. What the-- what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are you? What the fuck are you? Oh my God!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want a d10!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And look, Ashley's, like, somewhere, I can't even see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please tell me that was a gift from somebody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I made this myself, because I wanted you all to know how passionate I was about tonight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sam? Could you kiss your right gun?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Kiss it! Kiss it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mm. Tastes like strawberries. And sweat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Inspiration granted and immediately taken away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do your pants also have photoshopped lightning coming out of the crotch?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, my pants are just jeans.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, how far down does it go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All the way, baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the first step of the process. The pants come soon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you just do that at home with a--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I just penciled it in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have most of the individuals that are surrounding this, along with the few innocents, which just for the sake of appearance, here, I will go ahead and attempt to mark with a few markers so you know who you're looking for, innocents-wise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're the innocents, Matt. We're the innocents.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're not. Not anymore. All right, so, the red markers are going to act as markers for the innocent, just so you're aware.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy. Percy! Taliesin! You're on that roof, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy's over there. All righty, so, that all being the case, guys, as Grog shouted, at this moment the individuals in the center of the square start looking around, confused, not knowing where to come from. At this moment, a few of them manage to catch up a glance at the individuals that are on the rooftops. I need everyone to roll initiative, along with you, Grog, because combat has begun again at this point at the top.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, all of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you guys. This has started.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, that's not amazing. That's better. 14.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're still ahead of me. You rolled a nat 20?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why's he laughing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because he's fucking evil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 'Because he's fucking evil'? Is that what you said?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who said that? I will beat him with my fists.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, for the sake of this one, we have 25 to 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21, okay, so we have-- let's see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the people who wanted to go first are going first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, 20 to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. 15 to ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, getting into the double-digits!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you know. Moving on up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd rather have my low roll here than for anything else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, oh god, oh god, oh god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like a roller coaster. We're just going tick-tick-tick-tick-shooom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot here I'm keeping track of, guys. All right, so, the surprise round affects all the archers. It affects everyone except for these four individuals, or these two individuals with the clubs, and these two women here with big swords, and Kevdak. So, top of the round, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does the second story of the house that I'm in have windows? Can I see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second story does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I run up the stairs, then, so I can get a better look at the playing field?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, this one was supposed to go this way for the entrance point there. All right. So you are currently now looking out the side of the window.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to-- I'm already hiding, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, no one's seen you at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, then I'm going to Hunter's Mark Kevdak. And I'm going to hold my turn--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Putting a green on him for the Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to hold my turn until it seems like he's better incapacitated or until something happens. I'm going to hold my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold your action until--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think until Scanlan goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so that finishes your turn. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I at a window as well, downstairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are by a door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I half on a street? In a door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're inside the house right now. The door is technically partially ajar because you guys did slip in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to click my boots, crack the door a few inches, and I'm going to hold my turn until one of our magic-users pulls a trick or Kevdak takes a swing at Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The archers are surprised. They do not go. It is Kevdak's turn. Kevdak sees you shouting out. He rolled a natural 20 on his initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he didn't! That's why you shook your fucking head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I was like, man, all right. Let's start this right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking Wheaton!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 28 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll have to look, but I think it hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Second attack is a 30 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: These aren't Great Weapon Master, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, these are not Great Weapon Master.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is his attack fucking bonus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At least ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 30 points of slashing damage, reduced to 15. And two points of necrotic damage, because it's not reduced. And second one's going to be 22 points of slashing damage, reduced to 11, and then five points of necrotic on top of that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: However, for the second slash, I'm going to use Cutting Words to reduce the damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before he does that, you said 17 on the first one, 11 on the second attack, and how much necrotic on the second one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seven overall. Plus two necrotic on the first hit. Five necrotic on the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You might have to get a little bit closer to make sure that he can hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus that would be giving away your hiding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What're you going to do, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I step forward closer to him and I use Cutting Words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you step to the very edge of the rooftop here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the sake of this, right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I say, kiss our metaphorical hairy arses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just like that on your shirt. As he brings around his axe for a second swing, he hears that and glances over his shoulder and sees this shiny gnome butt up on the top. Continuing the swing, though, to attack. Go ahead and reduce the damage using your Cutting Words.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pff. One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take ten points of slashing damage from that strike. Oh, you're wielding Mythcarver, so his next saving throw is at disadvantage, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're not currently wielding your weapon, Kevdak's going to go ahead and take a step back and glance over at you, as he's going to move his fingers up and point towards the roof. And you see a bunch of the other entities and archers, whoosh, shift their attention over in your direction, Sam. All right, that finishes Kevdak's turn. Scanlan, you're up next. Actually, you do get an attack of opportunity on him with your fist. Because you're not holding your warhammer right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a five, plus what? My strength?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, it's your strength modifier plus your proficiency modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13, no. You punch his back and it just hits off his muscle. All right. Sam, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. From my crouched, butt-out position, whilst holding my Hand Cone of Clarity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you holding it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's shoved up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Between the legs, upside-down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before I make this attack, when I scanned around, did I see any of his allies without any weapons or carrying a staff or something like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they're all the type of people that would be at all times wielding something at their side. There are two individuals that you do notice, there is this one here, and there is Greenbeard right there, and they both appear to have some sort of a quarterstaff-type implement, but everything else is either bladed or giant clubs or some sort of big melee weapon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But they're surprised anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Okay. Well, then, I will cast Hold Person at level three on Kevdak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On Kevdak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At level three, so I get to target one other individual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I would target the beardy guy with the staff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Hold Person. For a minute, wisdom saving throw, for the duration. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wisdom saving throw with disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kevdak. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because of Cutting Words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For Hold Person, does it un-paralyze him if we hit him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And can I still move and do other things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can in a moment. We have to figure out if the other guy makes his save. He rolls a natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aw, man, the rest of these people are going to be real pissed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is where my held turn comes in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me too, but I was in front of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you hit him, does he become not paralyzed?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, he's stuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. At the end of each of his turns, the target can make another wisdom saving throw. And paralyzed, for those who are aware what paralyzation does, a paralyzed creature is incapacitated and cannot speak, automatically fails strength and dexterity saving throws, attacks rolls have advantage, and any attack that hits the target is a critical hit if it's within five feet of the creature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, five feet. Damn it. Oh, but that's good for Grog. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, wait. I still get my move, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Is there any cover? Are there chimneys? Is there anything I can duck behind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can duck behind the other side of this roof if you'd like.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And still maintain sight? Oh, wait, no, I'd be more than 60 feet away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, it's more the casting time. You can still move away once you've cast the spell and hold it there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that finishes your turn, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's paralyzed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as he steps away from you, points up, and all the archers turn towards that, everyone else looks over at the rooftop and you hear a cacophony of voices around growling, before Kevdak takes another step and (grunts). And you see the gleaming ass of Scanlan in the distance, the high noonday sun bouncing off of his pale, sun-dappled, gnomish skin. These two round globes of victory staring down from the rooftop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Round globes of victory! I love it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I walk around to the front of Kevdak?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to pick up your weapon first, or?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do the twins go first or does Grog go first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh right, because you held your actions, so, up to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, do your thing, do your thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. All right. So. We have now Vex, taking your shots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Yes. I'm going to shoot from my Longbow of the Sky Sentinel. So that's three attacks on the first attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and they all have advantage because he's paralyzed. This is bad for Kevdak, but we'll see how it works.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still raging, so everything's half-damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So 19 plus 12 probably hits on the first attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. 19 plus 12 hits on the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And 17 plus 12 hits on the third?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they all hit.

lines.name: LAURA

With the impact of the slam, it swings from the sheer force of the blow. As you push the blade to the hilt and even further in, you feel your hands actually push into the wound itself about an inch, your fingers getting dark and wet with the crimson gore of the interior of his body. As you push up inside, you pull back, pulling the blade around, in your pommel, and jam it over the top of the shoulder, into the side of his body, the muscle flexes from the tension of the Hold Person spell, managing to reduce a portion of the damage, but it left a pretty serious wound.
